TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit SerializerWriterCollator extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Defines the abstract methods required to implement a plug-in document serialization collator.

Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, initiates the start of a batch write operation.

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Cancel() cil managed

Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, cancels a synchronous <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Serialization.SerializerWriterCollator.Write%2A> operation.

MemberSignature.Value: public abstract void CancelAsync ();
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void CancelAsync() cil managed

MemberSignature.Value: public abstract void EndBatchWrite ();
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void EndBatchWrite() cil managed

MemberSignature.Value: public abstract void Write (System.Windows.Media.Visual visual);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Write(class System.Windows.Media.Visual visual) cil managed

Docs.param: The visual element to write to the serialization <xref:System.IO.Stream>.
Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, synchronously writes a given element to the serialization stream.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The Write method writes to the stream associated with the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Serialization.SerializerWriter> that created the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Serialization.SerializerWriterCollator> from the call to <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Serialization.SerializerWriter.CreateVisualsCollator%2A>.

MemberSignature.Value: public abstract void Write (System.Windows.Media.Visual visual, System.Printing.PrintTicket printTicket);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Write(class System.Windows.Media.Visual visual, class System.Printing.PrintTicket printTicket) cil managed

Docs.param: A that is written to the stream.
An object specifying preferences for how the material should be printed.
Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, synchronously writes a given element together with an associated print ticket to the serialization stream.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The Write method writes to the stream associated with the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Serialization.SerializerWriter> that created the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Serialization.SerializerWriterCollator> from the call to <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Serialization.SerializerWriter.CreateVisualsCollator%2A>.

MemberSignature.Value: public abstract void WriteAsync (System.Windows.Media.Visual visual);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void WriteAsync(class System.Windows.Media.Visual visual) cil managed

Docs.param: The visual element to write to the serialization <xref:System.IO.Stream>.
Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, asynchronously writes a given element to the serialization stream.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Serialization.SerializerWriterCollator.WriteAsync%2A> methods write to the stream associated with the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Serialization.SerializerWriter> that created the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Serialization.SerializerWriterCollator> from the call to <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Serialization.SerializerWriter.CreateVisualsCollator%2A>.

MemberSignature.Value: public abstract void WriteAsync (System.Windows.Media.Visual visual, object userState);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void WriteAsync(class System.Windows.Media.Visual visual, object userState) cil managed

Docs.param: The visual element to write to the serialization <xref:System.IO.Stream>.
A caller-specified object to identify the asynchronous write operation.
Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, asynchronously writes a given element with a specified event identifier to the serialization stream.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Serialization.SerializerWriterCollator.WriteAsync%2A> methods write to the stream associated with the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Serialization.SerializerWriter> that created the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Serialization.SerializerWriterCollator> from the call to <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Serialization.SerializerWriter.CreateVisualsCollator%2A>.
`userState` is passed to the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Serialization.WritingCompletedEventHandler> when the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Serialization.SerializerWriter.WritingCompleted> event occurs.

MemberSignature.Value: public abstract void WriteAsync (System.Windows.Media.Visual visual, System.Printing.PrintTicket printTicket);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void WriteAsync(class System.Windows.Media.Visual visual, class System.Printing.PrintTicket printTicket) cil managed

Docs.param: The visual element to write to the serialization <xref:System.IO.Stream>.
The default print preferences for the `visual` element.
Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, asynchronously writes a given element together with an associated print ticket to the serialization stream.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The WriteAsync method writes to the stream associated with the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Serialization.SerializerWriter> that created the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Serialization.SerializerWriterCollator> from the call to <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Serialization.SerializerWriter.CreateVisualsCollator%2A>.
`printTicket` can be `null` if there are no preferred print settings.

MemberSignature.Value: public abstract void WriteAsync (System.Windows.Media.Visual visual, System.Printing.PrintTicket printTicket, object userState);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void WriteAsync(class System.Windows.Media.Visual visual, class System.Printing.PrintTicket printTicket, object userState) cil managed

Docs.param: The visual element to write to the serialization <xref:System.IO.Stream>.
The default print preferences for the `visual` element.
A caller-specified object to identify the asynchronous write operation.
Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, asynchronously writes a given element together with an associated print ticket and identifier to the serialization stream.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The WriteAsync method writes to the stream associated with the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Serialization.SerializerWriter> that created the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Serialization.SerializerWriterCollator> from the call to <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Serialization.SerializerWriter.CreateVisualsCollator%2A>.
`printTicket` can be `null` if there are no preferred print settings.
`userState` is passed to the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Serialization.WritingCompletedEventHandler> when the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Serialization.SerializerWriter.WritingCompleted> event occurs.
